snippet: The newly elected president, Abdel Fattah el-Sisi, will have to take bold action to rescue a country in severe economic distress.
abstract: Editorial argues that overwhelming victory by Abdel Fattah el-Sisi in Egypt's presidential election was tarnished by turnout of only 47 percent, falling short of international standards of democracy; argues that with such a weak mandate, Sisi will have to take bold action to rescue a county that is in severe economic distress.
lead_paragraph: The newly elected president, Abdel Fattah el-Sisi, will have to take bold action to rescue a country in severe economic distress.
